page.title: 10A View of West Buckland
page.content: Mrs Davey has lived in the village all her life.She has noticed quite a few changes in her lifetime. The most noticeable change has been that new houses have been built,including two by R.Davey her son. An old house has been converted into a Post Office in the last year. The Church Tower is the only building in it's original state.It was built in the 13th century while the rest of the church was burnt down and then rebuilt in the 16th century. A batch of new houses is going to built behind the church which means a number of old barns will need to be demolished. The village hall was rebuilt some years ago because it was also burnt down.It is used for many village gatherings. Glen Davey
